title: How to Boost Your Wi-Fi Network With an Old Router
tags: how to boost your wifi signal with an old router
How to Increase the Range of your Wireless (Wi-Fi) Network
How to Extend Your Wi-Fi Network With an Old Router
description:
http://receivetipstricks.com/use-an-old-router-as-a-range-repeater/
Let say you are not getting enough signals at the other end of the building. So to extend WiFi coverage, we have couple of options here. 

First, you can install a custom firmware (like DD-WRT) on your router 
and increase your WiFi range to few meters. 

However this is a bit more technical and if not done right 
than it can even destroy your router and void your warranty. 


Second best option we have is to use a power line adapter 
Now, power line is a revolutionize product that uses your 
home electrical wiring to carry the WiFi signal. But as of now they are quite expensive and thus not feasible for home users


Next, Popular option is to use WiFi repeater. 
Simply place this WiFi repeater in the range of your existing router 
and it will further boost the signal.  

And last option, and also the one we are going to see in detail. 

is to boost wireless network by connect two routers with an ethernet cable. Technically it’s called creating an access point. 

Advantages of this setup is that it’s cheap, 
works well, and since we are using ethernet cable to share WiFi, 
it will work in the place where, there is no WiFi signal. 


So let’s see how to make it work
